[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Voucher Management System (VMS) defines requirements to streamline voucher processes, ensure secure delivery, and enhance efficiency in service provision for beneficiaries.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: VMS supports voucher creation, distribution, claims, and reporting for OBA programs managed by MSIU.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: VMS integrates with barcode scanners and biometric devices for secure verification.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: VMS provides dropdowns and guided workflows for administrators and providers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Compatible with barcode scanners, biometric systems, and desktops.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Built on Oracle DB and VB-compatible technologies with reporting tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Ensures encrypted data exchange for secure transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Optimized for scalability and high-volume transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: VMS operates continuously with scheduled maintenance windows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Configurable for diverse pilot programs and regional implementations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: VMS connects to reporting and monitoring systems for program evaluation.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: VMS automates voucher management, tracks claims, and generates actionable reports.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for administrators, service providers, and distributors with minimal training.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Requires stable networks and updated Oracle DB environments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Assumes operational infrastructure, compatible hardware, and MSIU standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with barcode scanners for voucher verification.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with biometric devices for claim authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall automate voucher creation and tracking (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall validate and process claims for approved service providers (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide guided workflows for voucher and claim management.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall use dropdown menus to minimize input errors.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process claims without significant delay (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to roughly a thousand concurrent users through optimized resource allocation and load balancing.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store voucher issuance and transaction data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall enable role-based access control and historical record retrieval.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow a modular design for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The database shall comply with MSIU security guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to OBA program requirements.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet ISO 27001 data security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale to accommodate growing data and users.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log and audit critical activities.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Testing validates claims processing, security, and reporting accuracy.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training guides, voucher management best practices, and operational insights for efficient program implementation.
[SEC] 5. References: MSIU Program Design Report, OBA Guide, Oracle DB documentation.
